p: Many viral mRNAs contain highly structured 5′-UTRs, suggesting that eIF4A inhibitors may block viral replication [ 21]. Indeed, Grünweller and collaborators found that silvestrol, at low nanomolar concentrations that are not toxic to cells, blocks viral mRNA translation and viral replication of Ebola virus and MERS-CoV in cells [ 6, 7]. Silvestrol also blocked the replication of poliovirus type 1, but at higher concentrations with an EC 50 value of 20 nM [ 7].
